meanings.definition: Having, exercising, or characterized by sound judgment; discreet; prudent.
meanings.sent1: She made a judicious decision to save money for a rainy day.
meanings.sent2: The judicious choice of colors made the room feel cozy and inviting.
meanings.sent3: His judicious selection of jokes kept the audience laughing all night.
meanings.sent4: The judicious use of spices in the dish created a symphony of flavors.
meanings.sent5: The judicious pruning of the tree resulted in a beautiful, healthy shape.

meanings.definition: Showing or having good judgment or sense.
meanings.sent1: The judicious student always completed assignments on time.
meanings.sent2: It was a judicious move to bring an umbrella on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent3: The judicious cat knew exactly when to ask for treats.
meanings.sent4: Her judicious investment in the stock market paid off handsomely.
meanings.sent5: The judicious use of sunscreen prevented sunburn during the beach trip.
